cause.description:
The Australian Greens, commonly known as The Greens, is the Green political party in Australia. The party has its eastern Australian origins in the Franklin River Dams campaign in Tasmania in the 1980s, and in Western Australia arising from concerns about nuclear disarmament. Its political platform now extends beyond environmental concerns to issues of the peace movement, grassroots democracy and social justice.
"Our vision is for a fair, independent and sustainable Australia."
www.greens.org.au
The Australian Greens is part of the Global Greens network, with around 70 Greens parties established world-wide. In 23 nations Greens have been elected to public office, and in European countries such as Germany, Latvia and France, Greens parties are part of governing coalitions. Find out more about the Global Greens at www.globalgreens.info
Vote Green to balance the big parties and hold them to account.
To donate, volunteer or join the Australian Greens visit www.greens.org.au
1. Ecological Sustainability
2. Social and Economic Justice
3. Peace and Non Violence
4. Grassroots Democracy
cause.mission: A fair, independent and sustainable Australia.
cause.name: Australian Greens
